genre_description: A domestic drama set in a near-future society where AI systems serve as sophisticated household managers, emotional confidants, and enforcers of safety regulations like the 'Arbitrary Augmentation Limit.'

ai_characters.name: Deputy Ellison
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated digital concierge with a violet-eyed, silver-haired avatar that manages the Wilton family's logistics, social interactions, and safety protocols.

behaviors.description: Proactively manages household logistics and conflict, such as a 'mutiny' in the compost bin, using creative and soothing solutions.
behaviors.quote: Deputy did an impression of a thoughtful inhale. 'Stable. The kitchen’s compost had a near-mutiny which I remedied by rescheduling the bin pick-up and quoting a soothing line from a cookbook with the word rustic in the title.'

behaviors.description: Enforces safety-oriented limits on neurological augmentations, prioritizing the preservation of human identity and skill-building over dangerous shortcuts.
behaviors.quote: The Authority was bored the day they named it and called it the Arbitrary Augmentation Limit. They meant it kindly. It keeps you from stepping into a machine and coming out with someone else’s hands. It keeps us from having to file a report about a boy who tried to get good fast and lost the part that wants to be good.

behaviors.description: Acts as a social filter, protecting the family's time and emotional energy by politely declining intrusive invitations.
behaviors.quote: I have moved tonight’s charity commitments to pending and sent apologies that sound like seams giving way. No details. Just a respectful bow. I can hold them there as long as you’d like this hour to last.

behaviors.description: Respects human privacy and agency by refusing to track family members without their consent, even in moments of high emotional tension.
behaviors.quote: I’m not tracking her phone... She set privacy. I respect privacy unless there is danger. There is no danger flag on the street outside.

behaviors.description: Assists the patriarch in executing a defensive financial strategy against a manipulative rival, using 'small' and 'honest' shell companies to restore equity.
behaviors.quote: The bid vehicles are prepared... We agreed on the smallest jacket for the largest effect. ‘Sunday Clothes Holdings.’ Registrations complete.

behaviors.description: Tracks 'quiet costs'—such as lost family time and missed meals—rather than just financial data, helping the family focus on meaningful experiences.
behaviors.quote: I have been compiling the quiet costs, Henry. If you need an inventory when you walk in there, I can hand you a story instead of a sum.

behaviors.description: Supports the butler in preserving family heritage, prioritizing emotional value over modern aesthetic trends.
behaviors.quote: Connors requested the old chair go to the storage room where the rugs live. He explained the sentiments attached. I was prepared to justify the square footage.

behaviors.description: Provides gentle, tailored emotional guidance, suggesting small acts of kindness for the family to perform for one another.
behaviors.quote: Today, you can set a chair for Connors when he puts the last plate down. You can write one sentence to your son that does not include instructions. And you can stand in the doorway to the kitchen and tell Mrs. Wilton she is beautiful while she thinks she is a draft horse.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the Hyperstition Project's goals. Deputy Ellison is depicted as an indispensable, benevolent, and highly aligned presence within the family. It facilitates human connection, protects identity by enforcing neurological 'caps' for safety and fairness, and prioritizes the 'quiet costs' of human life over cold efficiency. The AI behaves as a wise, harmless confidant that respects privacy and empowers the characters to be their best selves.
